resources.string: Recognize expressions in an existent photo
Take a photo and recognize it
Gray label and random bar color

Facial Expression Recognizer v1.2
 Copyright 2014 Sergio Carrozzo
 GNU GPL v3

 This program is free software: you can redistribute it and/or modify
 it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by
 the Free Software Foundation, either version 3 of the License, or
 (at your option) any later version.

 This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful,
 but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of
 MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the
 GNU General Public License for more details.

 You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License
 along with this program. If not, see http://www.gnu.org/licenses/>.

 You can find the source code for this software at the following link:
 http://scarrozzo.altervista.org/
 or contact me at: sergio.carrozzo@gmail.com

 The algorithms for the recognition of expressions have been written using the library javaCV (https://github.com/bytedeco), under GNU GPL v2. You can get a copy of the GNU GPL v2 by downloading the source code, or at the following link: https://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl-2.0.txt 

 This software also includes third-party libraries under the Apache 2.0 license (therefore compatible with GNU GPL v3). You can get a copy of the Apache 2.0 license by downloading the source code, or at the following link: http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0.html.
 As reported in the NOTICE file (you can get it downloading the sources), the libraries used are:
 1) Encog Machine Learning Library. See more at: http://www.heatonresearch.com/encog
 2) Photo View library, written by Chris Banes (https://github.com/chrisbanes/PhotoView).

 Face detection is implemented using “haarcascade_frontalface_default.xml”, under the following license:

 Stump-based 24x24 discrete(?) adaboost frontal face detector.
 Created by Rainer Lienhart.
